title: Singaporeâs services industries see business receipts decline 9.5 pct in Q3
content:
SINGAPORE, Nov. 27 (Xinhua) -- Business receipts of Singaporeâs services industries, excluding the wholesale and retail trade services and the accommodation and food services, fell 9.5 percent year on year in the third quarter of 2020, compared to a 13.4 percent decline in the previous quarter.
On a non-seasonally adjusted basis, the business receipts grew by 5.4 percent quarter on quarter in the third quarter, compared to a 12.9 percent decline in the second quarter, according to the Business Receipts Index released by Singaporeâs Department of Statistics on Friday.
In a breakdown, the business receipts of the transport and storage industry declined 21.6 percent year on year; that of the information and communication industry grew 3.5 percent; that of the financial and insurance industry fell one percent; that of the business services industry decreased 14 percent; that of the education industry fell 4.7 percent; that of the health and social services industry fell 1.8 percent; and that of the recreation and personal services industry declined 41.3 percent year on year. Enditem
